alert.note: Alert for Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 6:24AM EST until December 12 at 5:29PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast and East Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 AM EST, local law enforcement reported an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area causing flooding in the town of Penobscot. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Rapid snowmelt is also occurring and will add to the flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Ellsworth, Bar Harbor, Bucksport, Dexter, Newport, Blue Hill, Cherryfield, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Deer Isle, Veazie, Dedham, Castine, Kenduskeag and Steuben. - In the town of Penobscot the New Road, Dunbar Road and Southern Bay Road are closed due to standing or flowing water. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
